00026 #define CHIPMUNK_HEADER

00028 #ifdef __cplusplus
00029 extern "C" {
00030 #endif
00031 
00032 #ifndef CP_ALLOW_PRIVATE_ACCESS
00033         #define CP_ALLOW_PRIVATE_ACCESS 0
00034 #endif
00035 
00036 #if CP_ALLOW_PRIVATE_ACCESS == 1
00037         #define CP_PRIVATE(symbol) symbol
00038 #else
00039         #define CP_PRIVATE(symbol) symbol##_private
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 void cpMessage(const char *condition, const char *file, int line, int isError, int isHardError, const char *message, ...);
00043 #ifdef NDEBUG
00044         #define cpAssertWarn(condition, ...)
00045 #else
00046         #define cpAssertWarn(condition, ...) if(!(condition)) cpMessage(#condition, __FILE__, __LINE__, 0, 0, __VA_ARGS__)
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 #ifdef NDEBUG
00050         #define cpAssertSoft(condition, ...)
00051 #else
00052         #define cpAssertSoft(condition, ...) if(!(condition)) cpMessage(#condition, __FILE__, __LINE__, 1, 0, __VA_ARGS__)
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 // Hard assertions are important and cheap to execute. They are not disabled by compiling as debug.
00056 #define cpAssertHard(condition, ...) if(!(condition)) cpMessage(#condition, __FILE__, __LINE__, 1, 1, __VA_ARGS__)
00057

00059 #include "chipmunk_types.h"
00060         
00061 // Allocated size for various Chipmunk buffers
00062 #ifndef CP_BUFFER_BYTES
00063         #define CP_BUFFER_BYTES (32*1024)
00064 #endif

00068         #define cpcalloc calloc
00069 #endif

00071 #ifndef cprealloc
00072         #define cprealloc realloc
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 #ifndef cpfree
00076         #define cpfree free

00104 #define CP_VERSION_MAJOR 6
00105 #define CP_VERSION_MINOR 0
00106 #define CP_VERSION_RELEASE 2
00107 
00108 /// Version string.
00109 extern const char *cpVersionString;
00110 
00111 /// @deprecated
00112 void cpInitChipmunk(void);
00113 
00114 /// Calculate the moment of inertia for a circle.
00115 /// @c r1 and @c r2 are the inner and outer diameters. A solid circle has an inner diameter of 0.
00116 cpFloat cpMomentForCircle(cpFloat m, cpFloat r1, cpFloat r2, cpVect offset);
00117 
00118 /// Calculate area of a hollow circle.
00119 /// @c r1 and @c r2 are the inner and outer diameters. A solid circle has an inner diameter of 0.
00120 cpFloat cpAreaForCircle(cpFloat r1, cpFloat r2);
00121 
00122 /// Calculate the moment of inertia for a line segment.
00123 /// Beveling radius is not supported.
00124 cpFloat cpMomentForSegment(cpFloat m, cpVect a, cpVect b);
00125 
00126 /// Calculate the area of a fattened (capsule shaped) line segment.
00127 cpFloat cpAreaForSegment(cpVect a, cpVect b, cpFloat r);
00128 
00129 /// Calculate the moment of inertia for a solid polygon shape assuming it's center of gravity is at it's centroid. The offset is added to each vertex.
00130 cpFloat cpMomentForPoly(cpFloat m, int numVerts, const cpVect *verts, cpVect offset);
00131 
00132 /// Calculate the signed area of a polygon. A Clockwise winding gives positive area.
00133 /// This is probably backwards from what you expect, but matches Chipmunk's the winding for poly shapes.
00134 cpFloat cpAreaForPoly(const int numVerts, const cpVect *verts);
00135 
00136 /// Calculate the natural centroid of a polygon.
00137 cpVect cpCentroidForPoly(const int numVerts, const cpVect *verts);
00138 
00139 /// Center the polygon on the origin. (Subtracts the centroid of the polygon from each vertex)
00140 void cpRecenterPoly(const int numVerts, cpVect *verts);
00141 
00142 /// Calculate the moment of inertia for a solid box.
00143 cpFloat cpMomentForBox(cpFloat m, cpFloat width, cpFloat height);
00144 
00145 /// Calculate the moment of inertia for a solid box.
00146 cpFloat cpMomentForBox2(cpFloat m, cpBB box);
00147 
00148 #ifdef __cplusplus
00149 }
00150 
00151 static inline cpVect operator *(const cpVect v, const cpFloat s){return cpvmult(v, s);}
00152 static inline cpVect operator +(const cpVect v1, const cpVect v2){return cpvadd(v1, v2);}
00153 static inline cpVect operator -(const cpVect v1, const cpVect v2){return cpvsub(v1, v2);}
00154 static inline cpBool operator ==(const cpVect v1, const cpVect v2){return cpveql(v1, v2);}
00155 static inline cpVect operator -(const cpVect v){return cpvneg(v);}
00156 
00157 #endif
00158 #endif
